qas.question: At what pressure does PSA work best in?
What is synthesis gas used for?
Besides methane, what else can be used to produce synthesis gas?

context:
This reaction is favored at low pressures but is nonetheless conducted at <a0_0>high pressures<a0_0/> (2.0  MPa, 20 atm or 600 inHg). This is because high-pressure H
2 is the most marketable product and Pressure Swing Adsorption (PSA) purification systems work better at higher pressures. The product mixture is known as "synthesis gas" because it is often used directly for the <a1_0>production of methanol<a1_0/> and related compounds. <a2_0>Hydrocarbons<a2_0/> other than methane can be used to produce synthesis gas with varying product ratios. One of the many complications to this highly optimized technology is the formation of coke or carbon:
